description: End-to-end purchase management workflow for a company covering requisition intake, approvals, sourcing, purchase order issuance, supplier confirmation, goods receipt, invoice processing, and payment closure. The primary workflow sheet tracks each purchase request through sequential stages with planned vs actual dates and calculated delays, enabling SLA monitoring, accountability, and audit-ready traceability.

sheets.name: Purchase Workflow Register

columns.name: Serial No
columns.description: Row serial number for internal tracking

columns.name: Current Stage
columns.description: System-calculated or user-updated current stage name

columns.name: Last Updated By
columns.description: User who last updated the record

columns.name: Cancellation Reason
columns.description: Reason if the purchase is cancelled

columns.name: Hold Reason
columns.description: Reason if the purchase is put on hold

columns.name: Required By Date
columns.description: Date by which goods/services are required

columns.name: Policy Exception YN
columns.description: Whether exception to policy is requested

columns.name: Vendors Invited List
columns.description: Comma-separated vendor IDs/names or link to list

columns.name: PO Sent Date
columns.description: Date PO was sent to supplier

columns.name: Expected Delivery Date
columns.description: Expected delivery date as per logistics

columns.name: Payment Due Date
columns.description: Due date as per payment terms

columns.name: Cost Variance Notes
columns.description: Notes on cost variance vs budget/quote

stages.stage_description: Requestor creates a purchase requisition with item/service details, quantity, budget/cost center, and required-by date.
PR is reviewed for completeness, policy compliance, and approved as per approval matrix.
Procurement issues RFQ to vendors and collects quotations within the bidding window.
Commercial and technical evaluation is completed and the winning vendor is finalized.
PO is created with finalized terms and approved before release to supplier.
PO is sent to supplier and supplier confirms acceptance, delivery date, and key terms.
Tracks shipment/dispatch details until delivery at warehouse/site.

stages.stage_name: Goods Receipt Note GRN  Quality Inspection
stages.stage_description: Goods/services are received, GRN is created, and quality inspection is completed (if applicable).
Supplier invoice is received and matched against PO and GRN; discrepancies are resolved.
Payment is approved and released as per payment terms and finance controls.
Purchase is closed after confirming all deliveries, invoices, and payments; captures supplier performance and lessons learned.

sheets.description: Primary workflow sheet tracking the complete purchase lifecycle from PR to closure with stage-wise planned/actual dates and delay calculations.

sheets.name: Vendor Master
sheets.description: Reference master for supplier onboarding and selection.

sheets.name: Item Master
sheets.description: Reference master for items/services that can be purchased.

sheets.name: Department Master
sheets.description: Departments reference for requestor mapping and reporting.

sheets.name: Cost Center Master
sheets.description: Cost centers reference for budget allocation and accounting.

sheets.name: Tax Code Master
sheets.description: Tax codes reference for PO and invoice calculations.

sheets.name: Payment Terms Master
sheets.description: Payment terms reference (e.g., Net 30, Advance, Milestone-based).

sheets.name: Approval Matrix
sheets.description: Approval routing rules by amount, department, category, and PR/PO type.

sheets.name: Status  Dropdowns
sheets.description: Centralized dropdown values for consistent data entry across the system.

sheets.name: Purchase Import Dump
sheets.description: Optional dump/import sheet for bulk upload of purchase workflow records from external systems.
